page.title: 07LIFE IN STORTFORD IN 1939
page.content: Lisa Rowe tells us of a day in the life of her father in 1939. In 1939 my father was 5 years old. This would have been similar to an average day in his life. He would wake up early and with his dog Jock he would collect the eggs on our farmyard. After a fresh egg for breakfast, he would walk the half mile into the village to the village school. In winter, if the road was clear enough my father still had to walk there as there were no cars. Dad came home at lunchtime and then went back to school. At this time we had prisoners of war working on our farm. There were Germans and Italians. In summer when Dad came back from school he used to get a lift from our carthorses which pulled the haycarts.
